post.summary: Create Device Certificate by certificate name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

get.summary: Read Device Certificate by certificate name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

patch.summary: Update Device Certificate by certificate name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

delete.summary: Delete Device Certificate by certificate name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

name.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

cert-key-type.description: Configuration of certificate key type to RSA or ECDSA.

rsa-key-length.description: RSA Key Length when certificate key type is RSA.

ecdsa-curve-size.x-typeDescription: Elliptic Curve Size of ECDSA key.
ecdsa-curve-size.description: ECDSA Curve Size when certificate key type is ECDSA.

x-enumDescriptions.ALL: Certificate is assigned for use by all applications.
x-enumDescriptions.OPENFLOW: Certificate is assigned for use by openflow application.
x-enumDescriptions.WEB: Certificate is assigned for use by web application.
x-enumDescriptions.CAPTIVE_PORTAL: Certificate is assigned for use by captive-portal application
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by ssh-client application.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_SERVER: Certificate is assigned for use by ssh-server application.
x-enumDescriptions.SYSLOG: Certificate is assigned for use by syslog application.
x-enumDescriptions.RADSEC_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by RADsec client application.
x-enumDescriptions.DOT1X_SUPPLICANT: Certificate is assigned for use by Dot1x supplicant application.
x-enumDescriptions.EST_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by EST client application.
x-enumDescriptions.HSC: Certificate is assigned for use by hardware switch controller application.

items.x-typeDescription: The intended application type for the certificate.
items.description: The application(s) that use the Device Certificate.

subject-alt-name-dns.description: Subject Alternative Name entry containing a DNS name.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
The ipv4-address type represents an IPv4 address in
dotted-quad notation.  The IPv4 address may include a zone
index, separated by a % sign.
The zone index is used to disambiguate identical address
values.  For link-local addresses, the zone index will
typically be the interface index number or the name of an
interface.  If the zone index is not present, the default
zone of the device will be used.
The canonical format for the zone index is the numerical
format

The ipv6-address type represents an IPv6 address in full,
mixed, shortened, and shortened-mixed notation.  The IPv6
address may include a zone index, separated by a % sign.
The zone index is used to disambiguate identical address
values.  For link-local addresses, the zone index will
typically be the interface index number or the name of an
interface.  If the zone index is not present, the default
zone of the device will be used.
The canonical format of IPv6 addresses uses the textual
representation defined in Section 4 of RFC 5952.  The
canonical format for the zone index is the numerical
format as described in Section 11.2 of RFC 4007.

subject-alt-name-ip.description: Subject Alternative Name entry containing an IP Address.

items.x-typeDescription: The permitted uses of the certificate.
items.description: Key usage options of the certificate.

x-enumDescriptions.KEY_RESTRICTION_ENCIPHER: Restriction of key as encipher only.
x-enumDescriptions.KEY_RESTRICTION_DECIPHER: Restriction of key as decipher only.

key-usage-restriction.x-typeDescription: The key usage for the certificate.
key-usage-restriction.description: Restriction of key on key-agreement usage.

x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT_AUTH: Extended Key Usage for Client Authentication.
x-enumDescriptions.SERVER_AUTH: Extended Key Usage for Server Authentication.

items.description: Extended key usage options of the certificate.

est-profile.description: EST profile to use for Device Certificate enrollment.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

name.description: Name of Device Certificate to be configured.

cert-key-type.description: Configuration of certificate key type to RSA or ECDSA.

rsa-key-length.description: RSA Key Length when certificate key type is RSA.

ecdsa-curve-size.x-typeDescription: Elliptic Curve Size of ECDSA key.
ecdsa-curve-size.description: ECDSA Curve Size when certificate key type is ECDSA.

x-enumDescriptions.ALL: Certificate is assigned for use by all applications.
x-enumDescriptions.OPENFLOW: Certificate is assigned for use by openflow application.
x-enumDescriptions.WEB: Certificate is assigned for use by web application.
x-enumDescriptions.CAPTIVE_PORTAL: Certificate is assigned for use by captive-portal application
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by ssh-client application.
x-enumDescriptions.SSH_SERVER: Certificate is assigned for use by ssh-server application.
x-enumDescriptions.SYSLOG: Certificate is assigned for use by syslog application.
x-enumDescriptions.RADSEC_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by RADsec client application.
x-enumDescriptions.DOT1X_SUPPLICANT: Certificate is assigned for use by Dot1x supplicant application.
x-enumDescriptions.EST_CLIENT: Certificate is assigned for use by EST client application.
x-enumDescriptions.HSC: Certificate is assigned for use by hardware switch controller application.

items.x-typeDescription: The intended application type for the certificate.
items.description: The application(s) that use the Device Certificate.

subject-alt-name-dns.description: Subject Alternative Name entry containing a DNS name.

subject-alt-name-ip.description: Subject Alternative Name entry containing an IP Address.

items.x-typeDescription: The permitted uses of the certificate.
items.description: Key usage options of the certificate.

x-enumDescriptions.KEY_RESTRICTION_ENCIPHER: Restriction of key as encipher only.
x-enumDescriptions.KEY_RESTRICTION_DECIPHER: Restriction of key as decipher only.

key-usage-restriction.x-typeDescription: The key usage for the certificate.
key-usage-restriction.description: Restriction of key on key-agreement usage.

x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT_AUTH: Extended Key Usage for Client Authentication.
x-enumDescriptions.SERVER_AUTH: Extended Key Usage for Server Authentication.

items.description: Extended key usage options of the certificate.

est-profile.description: EST profile to use for Device Certificate enrollment.

common-name.description:
Common Name for the certificate.
For CX device, a multi word Common Name in quotes may be specified.
For CX device, valid length: 1-64 characters.

org.description:
Organization Name for the certificate.
For CX device, a multi word Organization Name in quotes may be specified.
For CX device, valid length: 1-64 characters.

org-unit.description:
Organization Unit Name for the certificate.
For CX device, a multi word Organization Unit Name in quotes may be specified.
For CX device, valid length: 1-64 characters.

locality.description:
Locality Name for the certificate.
For CX device, a multi word Locality Name in quotes may be specified.

state.description:
State or Povince Name for the certificate.
For CX device, a multi word State or Province Name in quotes may be specified.

country.description: A two letter ISO 3166-1 Country code for the certificate.

include-serial-number.description: Specifiy device serial number and base mac address.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
